reviews.positive_text: The hotel is in a quiet location away from the centre. It has a wonderful view over the lake. The hotel was clean and comfortable. Luis on reception was very professional and helpful. There was plenty of available free parking on the road just outside the hotel at this time of year. Our room was small and rather dark. The shower worked well and the bed was comfortable.
reviews.negative_text:
Unfortunately the wonderful dining room with stunning views is not used when the hotel is less busy. Guests are not even allowed in there when it's a rainy day and the outside terrace cannot be used. The small guest lounge nearby is very dark.
The spa pool is small and it's ‚Ç¨20 per hour.
We thought of staying for breakfast, even though ‚Ç¨25 seemed very expensive, but the rude behaviour of one waitress meant we went elsewhere.

reviews.review_title: Lovely hotel with a shocking value proposition &  pricing policy.
reviews.positive_text: Les Tresoms is set in a great location with wonderful views of Lake Annecy. This is a lovey hotel with very welcoming, professional  and helpful staff. Great breakfast choice and quality. The view of the Bastille Day firework display was exceptional.
reviews.negative_text: I simply did not understand the value proposition of this hotel. Examples -16 euros for an Aperol spritz and very ordinary at that. 25 Euros per night for our small dog - more than double any other hotel we have stayed at in France or Italy. Parking charges on their own site. 12 Euros for a beer. Bedroom quite small - ok for an overnight stay but too small for an extended stay. Overall we were not impressed.

reviews.review_title: Nice but too cramped and too snobby.
reviews.positive_text: Comfortable bed, great views of Lake Annecy and the mountains, easy parking (for about 12‚Ç¨ per day). We ate dinner once at the casual restaurant and it was good.
reviews.negative_text: Rooms are too small and cramped and lacking some amenities (a refrigerator would be nice). Our balcony faced the parking lot and it was too small to be comfortable or useful. Spa is overpriced for what it offers (basically two small steam rooms and a lukewarm bubbling pool, but no hot tubs). Breakfast was overpriced so we skipped it. Staff could have been more welcoming and informative. In general, we felt like the place was snobby. The walk to the Lake and old part of the Village is about 20 mins downhill. We took Ubers back because it was such a steep climb.

It‚Äôs quite a walk away from the town which wouldnt ordinarily bother us but we had aging large breed dog with us so it was hard (exhausting!) to both fill our days and be fair to the pooch. 
Also despite promoting themselves as pet friendly we were disappointed to not be able to eat with our dog other than breakfast on the terrace. We would have been very happy to have dinner on the terrace but they wouldnt accommodate this so we had to have room service - or choose to eat elsewhere. Driving into annecy wasn‚Äôt an option as parking is very difficult to get.  
We also thought there might helpful books regarding what to do and how to get there but we didn‚Äôt find this either. 
Whilst this not the most expensive hotel one could choose in the area, , it was one of the more elaborate ones we have chosen on our road trip so we were left a bit disappointed.

The shower with different colours and rains is a nice touch in the Spa though. Also when they say it is slippery, they really do mean it. I myself slipped and had to ice my knee for a whole night but they provided me with some ice when I asked for it.

reviews.positive_text: A beautiful hotel in a great location. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The restaurant food in the evening was really lovely (we didn‚Äôt try the other, Michelin star restaurant).
reviews.negative_text: Breakfast was very ordinary and very expensive ie ‚Ç¨25 each for a really ordinary hotel breakfast that you can get anywhere for half the price.

reviews.positive_text: We liked the location, it's above the lake with views, it's a short walk into the old town albeit a steep walk back.
reviews.negative_text:
A lot. The room was tiny, and I maintain it is far from the size stated on Booking.com. The bathroom is from another age, having to step into a bath and use a shower curtain (!) to  take a shower. The main restaurant is very expensive, for the other restaurant offered one set meal only with no choice, and at a higher price than stated on the menu. Parking is 90 cents an hour, which explained why the car park was  nearly empty and the road outside full.
But the room was the major problem. It is simply not fit for the price nor the type of establishment. We were on a 2.5 week driving tour, this was easily the smallest and least comfortable room we had, and not at the size stated on Booking.com. 
We were so put off by the whole experience that we didn't spend any time in the hotel nor spend any money there, we cannot comment on the spa etc. A great shame, we visited this hotel many years ago and had looked forward to another enjoyable experience. Not to be.

reviews.review_title: Nice hotel but service wasn‚Äôt 4 star quality
reviews.positive_text: The views of lake Annecy and mountains.
reviews.negative_text:
Room & bathroom was tiny & we stayed in a superior room with forest view. 
The staff weren‚Äôt very friendly - some were dismissive. We had one meal in the hotel and the service was slow and below par for a supposedly 4 star Hotel. There were no bar snack options - we just wanted a sandwich or something light at lunchtime but we were told it was out of season (we stayed the last week in June).  
The waiter service for drinks round the pool were practically non existent. 
Annecy itself is beautiful and there was plenty of choice for meals out but it required an Uber journey - there was a walk through the forest but parts were very steep and slippery and coming back up the hill required stamina - especially in the heat.
reviews.room_name: Chambre Sup√©rieure avec Balcon¬†-¬†C√¥t√© For√™t¬†-¬†Lit Double ou Lits Jumeaux

reviews.positive_text: The views were exquisite! Some staff were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.negative_text:
- Some staff were quite rude and unhelpful. The resort is very clearly understaffed. 
- The room, although it had aircon was set to a fixed 25 degrees which was not nearly cool enough for the heat.
- The hotel itself was riddled in dust and used pool towels lay around the pool for hours on end.
- We were told that there was a lunch menu for sharing and snacking, however, when we asked to order we were told it was closed.
- The dinner service was incredibly atrocious. From waiting over 40 minutes to receive food and a glass of wine, to receiving the wrong order and then the wrong items on our bill. The bread was as hard as a rock, could not eat it. 
- The Spa is ‚Ç¨20 per person and lacks any calm vibes. Your spa entrance is also only valid for 1 hour which you need to make a reservation for. The steam room was not working and the floors are very slippery. There is no easy way out of the spa pool.
- We were told we were going to get a room upgrade on Booking.com but we did not get a room upgrade.
- The tv in the room is not a smart tv so you cannot watch tv in your room if you wanted to just lie down and relax.
- The mini fridge in our room was broken. 
- We had a bee infestation in our room and it took almost an hour to get the bees out of our room. 

Overall, what was supposed to be the most romantic getaway for our engagement was an overpriced disappointment. We were hoping to go back here annually to celebrate pur engagement, but we certainly will not be going back.

reviews.negative_text:
My boyfriend and I recently stayed at this four-star hotel and spa in Annecy, France, with high hopes for a relaxing break. Unfortunately, our experience was far from what we expected.

Upon arrival, we discovered that the kettle in our room wasn‚Äôt working. After calling reception three times over a span of 45 minutes without any answer, I went down in person. The receptionist, who was in the back room, initially insisted that we didn‚Äôt have a kettle in our room. It took some back-and-forth, and only after she came up to see for herself did she bring us a replacement kettle‚Äîthough she wasn't sure they even had spares at first.

Our room was also uncomfortably hot, and when we asked about air conditioning, we were told that it had been turned off for the season, leaving only heating available. Opening the window to cool the room down seemed like the only option, but that led to another issue‚Äîthe excessive noise from the car park made it difficult to sleep. On our final morning, the night concierge was speaking on his phone right outside the reception entrance at around 6:30 AM, waking us up. I shouted down, asking him to please be quiet, but when he continued talking, I had to go downstairs and outside to ask him in person to move his conversation indoors. Even then, the disruption had already impacted our sleep.

One of the main reasons we booked this hotel was for the spa. While I had a massage, my girlfriend was looking forward to relaxing by the pool. However, loud construction work was taking place by the outdoor pool, which made it impossible to enjoy the spa facilities. The noise was so disruptive that it completely ruined the atmosphere, even during my massage. To make matters worse, my girlfriend was still charged for accessing the spa, despite the fact that the construction was ongoing and the steam room wasn‚Äôt working. The outdoor pool itself was closed for two out of the three days of our stay, further limiting the experience.
reviews.room_name: Chambre Sup√©rieure avec Balcon¬†-¬†C√¥t√© For√™t¬†-¬†Lit Double ou Lits Jumeaux

- Breakfast is ‚Ç¨25 per person yet no hot food was available either day, and was not restocked.
-The spa facilities are small and items are broken. They told us the "Hammam is unfortunately broken today", but if you read other reviews you can see it's been broken for months and not repaired.
-Paying ‚Ç¨350 a night for a room and then having to pay additionally to use the spa is poor.

You're paying for a view and nothing else.

reviews.positive_text:
Beautiful resort! Property and area is very nice and natural. We walked from the train station, which took about 30 minutes. Is not close to downtown if that is what you are hoping for. 

Staff were very kind upon arrival and upgraded our room. 

Room had a beautiful view overlooking the lake. Was stunning! Bed was comfortable! Robe and slippers were available in the room. Room had a safe as well.

The spa was very nice! The sauna was wonderful and the shower with different settings was unique. The pool in that space was not very warm, but had numerous sets of powerful jets. Was supposed to do an ice thing, but we didn‚Äôt understand how. Outdoor pool space was very nice but we didn‚Äôt go in as it was cold outside!
reviews.negative_text:
Bathroom was very tiny and the ceiling was very short. Thankfully we are shorter people. Hard to shower in the small shower! 

Ordered 2 coffees from the lobby bar and they were made using the same ‚Äúpod‚Äù system in the room (which are free) and were charged 12 Euros! Couldn‚Äôt believe it.

reviews.negative_text: This hotel does not feel like 4stars. The parking is up a huge Flight of stairs and the staff did not offer to help with our baggage. I got charged 11 euro for a glass of orange juice and 6 euro for a coffee. We asked to borrow a wine opener and they would not give us one. We rented the bikes for 4 hours then it started down pouring so we returned them within the hour and they didn't give us our money back. We were never greeted by staff. reviews.positive_text: The fact the cleaners came to your room every day. They were the only good thing about the hotel. They did a fantastic job.
reviews.negative_text: Paid ‚Ç¨912 for 4 nights for 2. Breakfast not included (no problems with that as I knew before hand) but was charged ‚Ç¨1500 when I arrived. Was told it was a deposit. Yes I did get it back 4 days after I arrived home. Was not told that in advance and needed that money for my holiday. The hotel to be fair had the room ready for us before the 4pm slot however on arrival we were hungry as up at 3am for a 6am flight. Was told we couldn't eat unless we booked in advance. We then asked for a drink and waited 15 to 20 minutes for one. Had to ask 3 different people. Was also told the hotel is a 15 minute walk into the town, it's a 30-35 minute walk. Through a forest all up hill in the dark on the way back. Plus there is an electric fence on that walkway that we certainly didn't know until a dog went mad because he touched it. His owner told us. Because the hotel was so far away we had to get up in the morning, walk into town and stay for the whole day so we wudnt have to do it 4 times only twice a day. We were exhausted. I asked about a taxi and the hotel could supply one for ‚Ç¨25 each time you went in or out of the town. We never ate in the hotel. We hated being there. No atmosphere. Even having a drink at night was shocking. No one in the bar at all. And if u had a shower after it was wet, it was very slippy. (shower was in the bath) I nearly slipped getting out and my son did slip. He fell right out onto the floor on his backside. I could go on and on about how horrible a hotel it is. U have to experience it to understand. My advice is don't. I absolutely loved annecy and will definitely visit again but not at this hotel. The best part is the day you walk out the door to leave.

reviews.positive_text: Die Ruhe
reviews.negative_text: Da gibt es einiges zu bem√§ngeln: Ein Zimmer von sieben reservierten Zimmern war eher eine umgebaute Besenkammer! Bestellte Getr√§nke wurden zum Teil nicht serviert. Vier von uns haben im Hotel-Restaurant gegessen: drei haben das komplette Men√º bekommen und einer gerade mal den Salat, dass Essen wurde, nie serviert und ist auch nach zweimaligem nachfragen immer noch vergessen gegangen. Er hat nie etwas vom Steak gesehen! Auf der Rechnung stand aber sein Essen drauf! F√ºr das Personal waren wir wie Luft, man hat uns einfach immer ignoriert. Die Pool-Umgebung ist in die Jahre gekommen und sollte dringend saniert werden, vor allem der Holzboden. Mal einen Besen in die Hand nehmen und das Laub vom letzten Herbst wegwischen oder die Spinnweben √ºberall im Aussenbereich, w√§re auch n√∂tig. Ein Depot von 150 Euro, dass jeder von uns sieben bezahlen musste, war auch sehr aussergew√∂hnlich, da ich ja alles schon mit der Kreditkarte am Abend beim Eichecken alle Zimmer bezahlt hatte. Wir haben auch beobachtet, dass andere G√§ste auch unzufrieden waren und deren Rechnungen auch nicht korrekt waren. Endlose Diskussionen mit dem Personal wegen unkorrekten Rechnungen bei Getr√§nken und Essen. Dieses Hotel sollte ein kr√∂nender Abschluss unserer wundervollen Motorrad-Tour in Frankreich sein, war aber ein pures Desaster!

reviews.negative_text:
Het ontbijt slechtste ooit, geen probleem met genoeg te betalen maar dan verwacht je wel kwaliteit en service. Niet dus. 
Het personeel. Welkom wilt u aub alles betalen plus een borg van ‚Ç¨ 800 voor vermoedelijk verbruik. 2de welkomst zin. 
Rondleiding zal ik u ‚Ä¶ geven ja , misschien straks uiteindelijk niet. Zoek het zelf uit. Bagage draagt u zelf maar. 
Kamers werden niet dagelijks gekuist, zelf niet bij ontbijt op bed. Het heeft 2 dagen staan stinken op de kamer. 
Wc papier niet aangevuld. 
Buiten hangt een continue geur van vet uit de keuken. 
Dit is het uitzicht van een 4 sterren hotel met de service van een 1 ster hotel.
